I've been planning some more for binary planets in the Othrys Planet Pack, and I have some questions.  

One of my future plans is to put the Earth-like planet Rea (pronounced REE-AH) in a binary system with another Earth analogue, Tethys. Around the binary planets, I want to put three captures planetoids named Vesta, Juno, and Ceres. Is it even possible with Sigma Binary to put other, smaller bodies around an equal-mass binary system? Not around one planet or the other, but BOTH of them.

Since ksp has some limitations in how it calculates orbits, even if you have 2 bodies with the same mass, you will always have a "major" body and a "minor" body.  

All ships will orbit the major body untill they enter the minor body sphere of influence.  

It should be technically possible to put stuff in orbit around the barycenter, but I nevet tried and I'm not sure what the result may be. When you get around to do that feel free to pm me the mod if you need help ;)
